item.title: Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream Release Date Revealed for April
item.content:encoded:
Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream now has a release date, and you can look forward to playing the Mii island life sim in just a couple of months.

During a Nintendo Direct show dedicated to the game today, Nintendo revealed that Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream will be released for Nintendo Switch on April 16th.

There was no mention of a native Switch 2 version of the game, nor of an update that will bring improved frame rates or better visuals for Nintendo's new machine, but the Japanese gaming giant did specify that Living the Dream will be playable on Switch 2, so that's nice.

As well as a release date reveal, the Direct show also contained lots of other information about the upcoming Tomodachi Life sequel.

Let's get one thing out of the way now: yes, it's possible to date characters with the same sex or gender as your Mii, and you can also specify a romantic preference for nonbinary characters if you want to.

This course correction on Nintendo's behalf is part of an attempt to make Living the Dream a more inclusive experience, after criticism of the original Tomodachi Life's omission of gay romance.

Much like in Animal Crossing: New Horizons, your island in Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream can be customized extensively, giving your Miis the opportunity to discover the village you've built for them and to create a life for themselves within.

If you don't have enough Miis to populate your island, don't worry; Living the Dream will let you create some from within the game itself as well as importing the ones that are already on your Switch.

Much like the original Tomodachi Life, the fun in this followup revolves around watching your Miis interact with one another and steering those interactions; it's essentially The Sims, but with Miis (and a heck of a lot more weirdness).

Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream launches for Nintendo Switch on April 16th. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Icarus PS5 and Xbox Series X|S Release Date Revealed for Late February
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Rocketwerkz has announced a release date for planetary survival game Icarus on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S, and you won't have to wait much longer to try the game outside of its PC home.

Icarus is officially arriving on consoles on February 26th, with console publishing duties being handled by Grip Studios, a support outfit that's worked on the likes of Mafia: The Old Country and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, among other games.

The console version of Icarus will include not only the base game, but also its New Frontiers expansion, which brings a massive extra region to explore, plus lots of new enemies, workshop items, and more.

What's more, if you pre-order Icarus on PS5 or Xbox Series X|S, you'll get access to the Pet Companions Pack DLC, which, as the name suggests, adds a number of adorable animals to pet and look after.

News of Icarus' console release date comes just a couple of weeks after Rocketwerkz and founder Dean Hall announced that the game had managed to rack up almost a million sales for itself during the most recent winter Steam Sale.

Hall also said that Icarus had managed to shift just shy of 250,000 "DLC units", although since the game has a number of smaller packs available in addition to its major expansion, that could just mean a whole bunch of what are effectively microtransaction purchases.

Just in case you're unfamiliar, Icarus is a survival game created by Dean Hall, one of the key players behind zombie sandbox DayZ. It's a PvE-focused affair that sees you (and, optionally, your squad) heading down to a planet on which terraforming has gone wrong and trying to survive its dangers.

You can check out Icarus right now on PC, and it's coming to PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S on February 26th. Stay tuned for more.
